item.title: First EA FC Open World Gameplay Has Leaked
item.content:encoded:
If you didn’t know, EA announced a while back that it was working on an open-world addition to the EA FC franchise. Recently, a new FC playtest has been underway, and it’s been revealed that it’s indeed for the open-world content. Gameplay footage has leaked and been shared already.

All publicity is good publicity. Yes, the EA FC open-world game mode playtest is supposed to be private, but the community is desperate to see what it looks like, what you can do, and how it plays. Internal documents have already revealed the expected EA FC open-world mode release window, and there’s gameplay to keep you ticking over.

EA FC Open World Gameplay Leaks Early

There were rumors that an EA FC open-world mode would be akin to NBA 2K’s open-world hub. It would include fun mini-games and ways to interact with other players.

This seems to be the case. You can check out leaked videos and gameplay, especially through FGZ, as they first reported that gameplay had leaked. You can also find snippets across all forms of social media.

Check out the initial media here, but be warned, there’s every chance EA will have the content removed.

Players can dip in and out of several mini-games, watch from the sidelines if needed, walk around, and talk to other users, and the initial maps look quite sizable. Rumor has it that there will be several maps to explore based on major countries.

Again, a quick search on X, TikTok, and YouTube is bound to give you the footage you’re looking for. It’s certainly out there. EA is presumably doing its best to clamp down on leaked clips and have the gameplay footage removed. You might need to be quicker than Mbappe to see certain videos!

Does an open-world EA FC gameplay mode interest you? Should EA be concentrating its efforts on other areas of EA FC, such as Career Mode or Clubs? The place to dissect all of this and more is the Insider Gaming Discord Server, which continues to grow each day.

item.title: All Black Ops 7 Zombies Perk-A-Colas, Explained
item.content:encoded:
The zombie horde returns to face off against players in Black Ops 7, and, as has become customary in the mode, there are a wealth of Perk-A-Colas available that assist in the battle to fend off the undead army.

Black Ops 7 launches worldwide on November 14, bringing a new campaign, complete with four-player co-op, multiplayer action, and Zombies, the latter of which will be expanded further with the addition of new maps throughout the game’s lifespan.

Perk-A-Colas have long been a core part of the mechanics of Zombies in the Call of Duty franchise, and we’ve got all the details on what will be available to save up for in Black Ops 7.

All Black Ops 7 Perk-A-Colas

Black Ops 7 Zombies launches with 12 Perk-A-Colas available, 11 of which are returning to the franchise, with the other being brand new.

Wisp Tea is the only new Perk-A-Cola added to Black Ops 7 Zombies at launch, with a unique benefit that summons a companion wisp after killing zombies. All other Perk-a-Colas in the game have featured in the franchise in the past, with the majority having been available in Black Ops 6.

Zombies will be regularly updated throughout the game’s lifespan, however, so new and returning Perk-A-Colas could come later down the line with seasonal updates.

The table below shows all of the available Perk-A-Colas at launch in Black Ops 7 Zombies, along with a description of the bonus they provide.

item.title: All Black Ops 7 Zombies Level Unlocks: Equipment, Field Upgrades & More
item.content:encoded:
Players diving into Zombies in Black Ops 7 have a long to-do list to unlock all of the available items, as some of the most powerful pieces of equipment and Field Upgrades are restricted to level unlocks—and we’ve got all the details.

Black Ops 7 launches on November 14, equipped with a brand new Zombies adventure to work through from the off, and there’s plenty of additional content planned for the future with new maps and more.

Whether you’re an experienced Zombie slayer or are a new recruit in the battle to fend off the undead horde, we’ve got all the details on the Black Ops 7 Zombies level unlocks.

All Black Ops 7 Zombies Level Unlocks, Listed

There is a wide range of level unlocks for Black Ops 7 Zombies, with minimal items and equipment available immediately.

Better gear makes it easier to advance deep into the later rounds in Zombies, so grinding for them is recommended. Some are much more powerful than others and should be immediately topping your wish list.

Unlockables in Black Ops 7 Zombies include Lethal Equipment, Tactical Equipment, Field Upgrades, Gobblegums, Support Items, and Ammo Mods.

item.title: Red Dead Redemption 2 Has Become the Fourth Best-Selling Game Ever
item.content:encoded:
According to the numbers provided in Take-Two Interactive’s latest earnings release, Red Dead Redemption 2 has become the fourth best-selling game of all time in terms of units sold.

Rockstar Games dominates the gaming industry, a fact widely acknowledged due to the developer’s remarkable portfolio. However, they have outdone themselves this time around by having not one, but two games in the best-selling titles of all time list: Grand Theft Auto 5 and Red Dead Redemption 2.

Red Dead Redemption 2 Has Sold Over 79 Million Units, Surpassing Mario Kart 8

As revealed during Take-Two’s latest earnings call, Red Dead Redemption 2 has surpassed 79 million units, and the series has sold a total of 106 million units globally. Moreover, analyst data reveals that RDR2 has been the “best-selling title of the past 7 years in the US based on dollar sales.” Additionally, Red Dead Online comes free with every copy of Red Dead Redemption 2, and a standalone online version was also released in 2020.

Mario Kart 8 was previously at the fourth spot for best-selling games of all time (units sold), with the title pushing 78.02 million copies across the Wii U and Nintendo Switch. Now Red Dead Redemption 2 has taken its place, and the only games ahead of it are Wii Sports with 82.9 million units (bundled with Wii U consoles), Grand Theft Auto 5 with over 220 million units sold-in to date, and in the first spot, we have Minecraft with over 350 million sold.

In other news, Red Dead Redemption 2 was met with skepticism due to budget and timeline issues. Additionally, GTA 6’s delay could impact games like Halo Remake, Gears E-Day, and the next Call of Duty. item.title: Sonic Racing CrossWorlds Releases for Switch 2 Next Month
item.content:encoded:
Sonic Racing CrossWorlds is releasing digitally on the Nintendo Switch 2 on December 4, 2025.

Mario Kart is the franchise that has dominated Nintendo’s consoles in the racing genre for the longest time, with the latest entry to the franchise, Mario Kart World, already nearing 10 million units. However, a new competitor is entering this space, and it will make its grand debut on the platform next month.

Sonic Racing CrossWorlds Release Date, Upgrade Pack Bonuses and More

As announced through the latest update on their website, Sonic Racing CrossWorlds’ Nintendo Switch 2 digital release date has been set, and it arrives in less than a month. Moreover, players who already own the Switch version can purchase the upgrade pack for the latest console. The Switch 2 version of Sonic Racing CrossWorlds will offer players improved graphics resolution and higher frame rates. The release date for the physical version has not been revealed; however, we do know it will use a game card.

There are some bonuses players can grab as well if they purchase the Switch 2 version of Sonic Racing CrossWorlds in a given period of time. If you buy the title between 8:00 AM on December 4, 2025, and 7:59 AM on December 18, 2025 (UTC+8), players will receive the Werehog Pack. Additionally, if the upgrade pack is purchased from 8:00 AM on December 4, 2025, to 7:59 AM on December 11, 2025 (UTC+8), it will cost half the price.

Furthermore, suppose players are looking to purchase the the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition and Season Pass at a discounted price. In that case, they can do so by purchasing both Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds Digital Deluxe Edition for Nintendo Switch, which includes the base game, season pass, and upgrade pack. Also, saved data can be transferred from Switch 1 to Switch 2.

Sonic Racing CrossWorlds Switch 2 Edition Game Size, Performance Details, and Crossplay

Coming to the technical details, Sonic Racing CrossWorlds on the Switch 2 will require 16GB of storage space and will support crossplay. Regarding the performance and graphics details, here’s how it will work:

  • TV Mode (1–2 players): 2560 x 1440, 60 FPS
  • TV Mode (4 players): 2560 x 1440, 30 FPS
  • Handheld Mode (1–2 players): 1920 x 1080, 60 FPS
  • Handheld Mode (4 players): 1920 x 1080, 30 FPS

In other news, Sonic the Hedgehog 4 might be renamed to Sonic CD, the game it is based on. Additionally, Sonic Rumble was released for PC and Mobile a few days ago. item.title: When Does The Black Ops 7 Zombies Main Quest Launch? Release Date & Time, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Zombies returns in Call of Duty: Black Ops 7, and there’s plenty to sink your teeth into, including the main quest that advances the story and provides a bunch of easter eggs.

Black Ops 7 releases on November 14, and Zombies is a huge part of the launch, with several maps planned, the return of Dead Ops Arcade, and plenty more teases.

For those wanting to dive immediately into the main quest in Black Ops 7, we’ve got all the details on when you can get your journey started.

When Does The Black Ops 7 Zombies Main Quest Launch?

The main quest in Black Ops 7 Zombies will be available from 10 AM PT on Friday, November 14.

This release is over 12 hours after the main release of Black Ops 7, so you will have to wait a little longer once you jump into the game for the main quest to go live.

Additionally, Directed Mode will not be available at launch or when the main quest goes live. Instead, Directed Mode will land at the start of Season 01 later in the year.

The table below shows the release times for the main quest in Black Ops 7 Zombies in major time zones across the world.

Can You Play Zombies Before The Main Quest Launch?

Yes, Zombies will be fully playable as soon as Black Ops 7 launches, and you don’t need to wait for the main quest launch to jump into the mode.

However, many secrets will be locked at this stage, likely meaning you won’t have full access to all the available Wonder Weapons, and other Easter Eggs won’t be live.

You will be able to play the mode and level up your account, however, which is required to access features like Research, and Zombies will remain a great place to gain the XP needed to push through the early player levels in Call of Duty.

What mode will you be diving into first in Call of Duty: Black Ops 7? Let us know in the Insider Gaming Discord.
